description.narrative: Crystal Crop Protection Limited (Crystal or the Company) is one of the major agrochemical players in India. Crystal manufactures and markets a broad range of crop protection products (insecticides, fungicides, and herbicides), as well as seeds and farm equipment, predominantly for the domestic India market. The Company is well-diversified across crops, has a large existing portfolio of generic crop protection products and is now strategically developing its own branded formulations. Crystal provides crop protection products that cater to entire lifecycle of crops from sowing to harvesting and assist the Indian farmer to maximize productivity and profitability. Crystal plans to (i) further expand Crystals own in-house manufacturing of active ingredients (technicals), which will help it to further backward integrate and reduce dependence on imports of technicals (ii) fund capital expenditure to expand capacity, improve IT infrastructure and automation in its plants, (iii) fund working capital requirement; (iv) setup solar plants in its production units to promote cleaner energy and reduce power costs, and (v) fund costs for domestic and global product registrations (all together, the Project).

The most significant expected project-level outcomes are: (i) Stakeholder effects: The Project will improve farmers' productivity through better access to customized agrichemicals by enabling the development of formulations that are particularly well-adapted to local crop, soil, and environmental factors and through sale of affordable, generic pesticides. (ii) Economywide effects: The Project will create jobs and add value through backward linkages, where they will produce in-house the active ingredients required to produce their agrichemicals The Project will also create additional direct skilled jobs. The employees will learn new skills and technology to produce these active ingredients (iii) Competitiveness: The Project is expected to demonstrate backward integration, to improve cost control of the value chain, production efficiency as well as the ability innovate and produce high quality the products, and thus improving the sector's competitiveness.
